intro: Mastigostyla peruviana, commonly known as the Peruvian spurge, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Peru. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, often hairy leaves and yellowish-green flowers. The plant is typically found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds dispersed by wind. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
